channel.title: 彭博-市场
channel.description: 这是一个追踪彭博-市场news的种子

item.title: 美国各地的房租都在降温。在纽约，租金上涨了两位数。
item.description:
Rents are cooling across the US. In New York, they're up double digits. https://t.co/nvVDAqklkp

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 随着比特币突破 60,000 美元并创下新纪录，投资者在一天之内向贝莱德的比特币 ETF 投入了创纪录的 5.2 亿美元。
item.description:
As Bitcoin surged past $60,000 and on toward a new record, investors pumped a record $520 million into BlackRock’s Bitcoin ETF in a single day https://t.co/uDQvqjLYUX

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 随着比特币突破 60,000 美元并创下新纪录，投资者在一天之内向贝莱德的比特币 ETF 投入了创纪录的 5.2 亿美元。

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行首席执行官表示，城市国民银行在加拿大皇家银行的控股下发展迅速，这也是导致这家地区性贷款机构头疼的原因所在
item.description:
City National Bank grew at a rapid pace under Royal Bank of Canada’s ownership, and that’s what led to the regional lender’s headaches, RBC CEO says https://t.co/qTHWn47NIr

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: Coinbase 周三接连发生故障，部分用户的账户余额可能为零。

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯表示，要达到 2% 的通胀率仍 "任重道远
item.description:
Fed’s Williams Says Still ‘Ways to Go’ to Reach 2% Inflation https://t.co/81bgNewZQ8

item.title: 比特币两年多来首次升至 60,000 美元，人们对比特币的需求不断扩大持乐观态度
item.description:
Bitcoin rose to $60,000 for the first time in more than two years, amid surging optimism that demand for the token is widening https://t.co/rDO0IYGgHL pic.twitter.com/APWkfIcNGX

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 委内瑞拉为今年的选举设定了新的条件，藐视美国斡旋达成的协议，并可能引发华盛顿更严厉的制裁。
item.description:
Venezuela set new conditions for elections this year, flouting a US-brokered agreement and potentially triggering tougher sanctions by Washington. https://t.co/YVmO7WCRFA

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 美国及其欧洲盟国表示，他们决心以某种方式利用被冻结的俄罗斯资产来帮助乌克兰。本周在巴西，他们正在争论在不陷入法律或财政危险的情况下实现这一目标的最佳方式。
item.description:
The US and its European allies say they’re determined to use frozen Russian assets to help Ukraine – somehow. In Brazil this week, they’re arguing about the best way to do it without getting into legal or financial jeopardy. https://t.co/9fpxWiEXXZ

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 英国公众在预算案发布前为政府提供了意想不到的资金支持
item.description:

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 阿根廷航空业工人举行 24 小时罢工，数百航班被取消

item.title: 英国全国各地的城镇都在破产，从公园到成人社会关怀，都在削减开支。问题出在哪里
item.description:
UK towns are going bankrupt across the country and are slashing spending on everything from parks to adult social care. Here's what's gone wrong https://t.co/gqgLqGxvPO

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 自上周加沙停火投票摊牌以来，今天迎来了英国首相的首次质询。有迹象表明，一个新的令人不安的时代即将到来。与 @AllegraStratton 一起获取报道
item.description:
Today saw the first UK Prime Minister's Questions since last week’s showdown over the Gaza ceasefire vote. And there are signs of a new unsettling era. Get The Readout with @AllegraStratton https://t.co/A8sk0izt4h

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 总统候选人克劳迪娅-谢恩鲍姆的团队正在讨论墨西哥是否应恢复能源项目拍卖，以帮助满足其庞大的资金需求
item.description:
Presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum’s team is discussing whether Mexico should revive auctions for energy projects to help finance its vast requirements https://t.co/QpgXlwtEfl

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 一些世贸组织成员正在考虑呼吁各国政府为绿色转型遏制扭曲贸易的政策
item.description:

item.title: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）的战术专家斯科特-鲁布纳（Scott Rubner）表示，事实证明，我们无法预测美国股市的峰值。
item.description:
It has proved impossible to call the peak in this euphoric US stock market, says Goldman Sachs' tactical specialist Scott Rubner https://t.co/VW1bN7l0Yl

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 预计加拿大央行将在 4 月份首次降息的分析师并不多见，但他们认为经济数据可能很快就会证明存在足够的通货紧缩压力，从而促使决策者采取行动
item.description:
Analysts who expect the Bank of Canada’s first interest rate cut in April are rare – but they believe economic data may soon prove there’s enough disinflationary pressure to spur policymakers into action https://t.co/TwoRCp4lYn

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 全球财政首脑们准备在 20 国集团会议结束后集体缄默，不再谈论他们到底借了多少钱。
item.description:
Global finance chiefs are poised to march out of their G-20 meeting with a sense of collective reticence to talk about just how much they’re borrowing https://t.co/TicVjd7Mxf

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: S&P 公司的分析师警告说，南非决定利用本国黄金和外汇储备的利润来抑制债务水平，这可能会影响中央银行的独立性。
item.description:
South Africa’s decision to tap profits on the country’s gold and foreign-exchange reserves to curb debt levels could impact the independence of the central bank, S&P analysts warn https://t.co/4zZJx9MAIy

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 尼日利亚大幅提高银行现金储备监管要求，可能使最大贷款机构的贷款增长速度减半以上
item.description:
Nigeria’s steep increase in regulatory cash reserve requirements for its banks could more than halve the pace of loan growth for the biggest lenders https://t.co/phbBmv87ck

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 欧洲央行监事会成员伊丽莎白-麦考尔（Elizabeth McCaul）表示，欧洲银行需要提高管理与对冲基金等客户打交道时所面临风险的能力
item.description:
European banks need to improve their ability to manage the risks they face in dealing with clients such as hedge funds, Elizabeth McCaul, a member of the ECB’s Supervisory Board, says https://t.co/wgQgUgBMMi

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 埃及收到了阿联酋承诺的 350 亿美元资金的首批转账，这一大规模一揽子融资计划使货币贬值更近一步，并应释放出更多的国际援助
item.description:
Egypt receives the first transfers from the $35 billion in funds pledged by the UAE, a massive package of financing that brings closer a currency devaluation and should unlock more international assistance https://t.co/22C7Z42fR9

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 在一群债权人和投资者获准控制这家陷入困境的法国零售商几天后，Casino 报告 2023 年亏损 57 亿欧元。
item.description:
Casino reports a loss of €5.7 billion for 2023, days after a group of creditors and investors won approval to take control of the embattled French retailer https://t.co/k19AymH7LE

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 印度在本周举行的世贸组织会议上回击了有关其阻碍进展的说法，称印度希望在全球经济中 "公平竞争"，而全球经济规则长期以来一直向穷国倾斜。
item.description:
India pushed back at suggestions that it’s blocking progress at a WTO meeting this week, saying it wants “fair play” in a global economy where the rules have long been tilted against poor nations https://t.co/klIxkKB7CO

— Bloomberg Markets (@markets) February 28, 2024

item.title: 货币市场基金正迅速吸引因其他行业收益不佳而失望的 ESG 投资者
item.description:
Money market funds are fast becoming a magnet for ESG investors disillusioned by lackluster returns elsewhere in the industry https://t.co/HOZPpa9vok

item.title: 在 1.7 万亿美元的私人信贷行业中，基金经理往往比其他人更看重他们的贷款。监管机构开始担心
item.description:
Fund managers in the $1.7 trillion private credit industry often value their loans more generously than others do. Regulators are starting to worry https://t.co/XuZeYPmLCz
